extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 bunches of baby bok choy, torn into pieces

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 celery stalks, cut into half moons

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 long Japanese eggplant, cut into half moons

extendedIngredients.originalString: Optional: 2-3 tablespoons fish sauce or Â¼ cup of Prawn Stock

recipes.title: Vegetarian Thai Curry with Udon Noodles

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc are my top picks for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Columbia Winery Cellarmaster's Riesling. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 12 dollars.

productMatches.title: Columbia Winery Cellarmaster's Riesling
productMatches.description: The Columbia Valley Cellarmaster's Riesling is sweet and beautifully balanced with classic floral aromas. This wine is almost clear in color, as Rieslings have very little pigment and are generally tank fermented. Flavors of juicy tropical fruit, peach and freshly squeezed lime create a zippy natural acidity.This wine pairs well with spicy Szechuan and Thai dishes, as well as glazed ham.

recipes.instructions: Place frozen udon noodles in a bowl and fill with hot water. Set aside.Heat oil in a cast iron or non stick frying pan over medium high heat. Add tofu and cook till browned on one side, about 7-8 minutes. Carefully flip over tofu and brown on the other side.Meanwhile, combine coconut milk, 1 cup of water, curry paste, soy sauce, siracha and optional fish sauce or prawn stock in a large pot. Bring to a boil and add eggplant. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes. Add onion and simmer for 5 more minutes.Drain the udon noodles and add them to the pot.Add all remaining vegetables at the same time and stir well. Cook for 2 more minutes (be careful not to over cook the veggies, they turn to mush very easily!)Remove from heat and stir in green onions and tofu.Enjoy!

steps.step: Place frozen udon noodles in a bowl and fill with hot water. Set aside.
Heat oil in a cast iron or non stick frying pan over medium high heat.

Add tofu and cook till browned on one side, about 7-8 minutes. Carefully flip over tofu and brown on the other side.Meanwhile, combine coconut milk, 1 cup of water, curry paste, soy sauce, siracha and optional fish sauce or prawn stock in a large pot. Bring to a boil and add eggplant. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add onion and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Drain the udon noodles and add them to the pot.
Add all remaining vegetables at the same time and stir well. Cook for 2 more minutes (be careful not to over cook the veggies, they turn to mush very easily!)
Remove from heat and stir in green onions and tofu.Enjoy!
